list.title: D3GraphCanvas#D3GraphCanvas
list.description: Create a new D3 graph from an RDF JSON object. Adapted from https://observablehq.com/@d3/force-directed-graph#chart and https://www.d3indepth.com/zoom-and-pan/

list.title: D3GraphCanvas#canvas
list.description: Getter for retrieving the d3 svg.

list.title: D3GraphCanvas#clearCanvas
list.description: Remove nodes and lines from the SVG.

list.title: D3GraphCanvas#drag
list.description: Create a drag effect for graph nodes within the context of a force simulation

list.title: D3GraphCanvas#handleZoom
list.description: A handler function for selecting elements to transform during a zoom event

list.title: D3GraphCanvas#hide
list.description: Hide the graph SVG

list.title: D3GraphCanvas#prefixLegend
list.description: Check if a list of URIs have namespaces in the known namespace list. If so, replace the namespace of the URI with a prefix. The known namespace list is declared in a configuration file.

list.title: D3GraphCanvas#show
list.description: Show the graph SVG

list.title: D3GraphCanvas#update
list.description: Clear and update the d3 SVG canvas based on the data from a graph dataset. Also apply event dispatchers

list.title: Graph
list.description: Create a new Table using D3.

list.title: Graph#clear
list.description: Remove nodes and lines from the SVG.

list.title: Graph#formatResponseData
list.description: update the graph nodes and links.

list.title: Graph#getLinksByIndex
list.description: Get all of the links associated with a node by node index.

list.title: Graph#getLinksByUri
list.description: Get all of the links associated with a node by node uri.

list.title: Graph#getNodeByIndex
list.description: Get a data node by index.

list.title: Graph#getNodeByUri
list.description: Get a data node by uri.

list.title: Graph#getNodeColorId
list.description: Get the id (or index) of a uri from the typeList. Each type in the type list is used to color nodes in the graph. If the uri does not exist in the typeList, add the uri.

list.title: SparqlEndpointResponseProvider
list.description: Creates a SPARQL Endpoint Provider

list.title: SparqlEndpointResponseProvider#querySparqlEndpointService
list.description: Perform a SPARQL Query. Cache and return the response

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow
list.description: Creates a SPARQL query window.

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#clearDataView
list.description: Clear the DataView of content.

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#d3Graph
list.description: Contains the D3 graph view to display RDF data.

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#initHtml
list.description: Initialize the html of the view

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#jsonRenderer
list.description: A reference to the JsonRenderer class

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#queries
list.description: Store the queries of the SparqlQueryWindow from the config.

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#sparqlProvider
list.description: The SPARQL Endpoint Response Provider

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#table
list.description: Contains the D3 table to display RDF data.

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#updateDataView
list.description: Update the DataView.

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#updateQueryDropdown
list.description: Update this.querySelect options using an array of queries. For each element in the array, create an option element, set the innerText of the option to the query's title, set the value of the option to the index of the query in the array, then append the option to this.querySelect

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#updateQueryTextArea
list.description: Update the this.queryTextArea with the text of the query that was selected in the dropdown

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#updateResultDropdown
list.description: Remove all the children of this.resultSelect, then adds new children options based on the formats declared in each query configuration from from this.queries

list.title: Table
list.description: Create a new Table using D3.

list.title: Table#clearTable
list.description: Clear table.

list.title: Table#dataAsTable
list.description: Format and update the data in the table with data.

list.title: Table#initHtml
list.description: Initialize the html of the view

list.title: Table.update
list.description: Update the table with new data.
